article_title: Republican Susan Collins Wins Another Term
article_text:
Collins, who was first elected to the Senate in 1996, consistently led Bellows in polling throughout the course of the race.

Bellows, a former head of the ACLU of Maine, campaigned on her record advocating for civil liberties. Over the course of her re-election campaign, Collins bolstered her independent support by coming out in support of marriage equality and claiming it was too late for Republicans to repeal the Affordable Care Act.

article_metadata.description:
Sen. Susan Collins (R-Maine) defeated Democrat Shenna Bellows in the state's Senate contest Tuesday, Fox News and NBC News report.
